meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get our groove on and review the fantastic Braid: Anniversary Edition!

Now, I know what you're thinking - another remaster of an oldie but goodie. But trust me, folks, this one is worth your while. And if you don't believe me, just take a look at these fancy scores from some big-time critics (wink, wink, nudge, nudge).

First off, let's get the serious business out of the way. The Anniversary Edition brings Braid into the 21st century with updated visuals, animations, and sounds that make this indie classic shine like a hippo in the sun. But what really matters is whether or not it's still fun to play.

And here's where things get interesting. Some critics are saying that Braid: Anniversary Edition is a must-play for longtime fans, while others think that newcomers might enjoy it more since they won't be comparing it to the original ( Metro GameCentral - "a classic indie game that remains as cleverly unique today as it did 16 years ago..."). Meanwhile, some critics are saying that the Anniversary Edition isn't all that different from the original, which makes it a tough sell for those who have already played Braid (PlayStation LifeStyle - "the core package has changed very little").

Now, I'm not here to argue with the experts. But let me tell you, as someone who loves poking fun at myself and others, this game still holds up today. The puzzles are challenging yet rewarding, the visuals are stunning (especially those beautiful water effects!), and the storyline is engaging without being too long-winded.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I'm not going to give away my score just yet (wink). But let me tell you that Braid: Anniversary Edition is a fantastic way to experience this timeless classic - whether you're a newcomer or a returning fan. Just don't expect any new earth-shattering revelations from the game itself, but rather a chance to appreciate its enduring charm.

That's it for now, folks! Stay groovy, and keep on gaming!
